results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} having k runs of odd entries (1<=k<=ceiling(n/2)). For example, the permutation 321756498 has 3 runs of odd entries: 3, 175 and 9.
comment: Sum of entries in row n is n! (=A000142(n)).
example: T(4,2)=12 because we have 1234, 1432, 3214, 3412, 1243, 3241 and their reverses.
maple: ae := proc (n, k) options operator, arrow: factorial(n)^2*binomial(n+1, k)*binomial(n-1, k-1) end proc: ao := proc (n, k) options operator, arrow: factorial(n)*factorial(n+1)*binomial(n, k-1)*binomial(n+1, k) end proc: T := proc (n, k) if `mod`(n, 2) = 0 then ae((1/2)*n, k) else ao((1/2)*n-1/2, k) end if end proc: for n to 12 do seq(T(n, k), k = 1 .. ceil((1/2)*n)) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
mathematica: T[n_?EvenQ, k_] := (n/2)!^2*Binomial[n/2 - 1, k - 1]*Binomial[n/2 + 1, k]; T[n_?OddQ, k_] := ((n - 1)/2 + 1)!*((n - 1)/2)!*Binomial[(n - 1)/2 + 1, k]*Binomial[(n - 1)/2, k - 1]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, 1, Floor[(n + 1)/2]}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 13 2016 *)
